entry.title: What is a One-Time Browser?
entry.summary: TLDR: You can instantly get a one-time browser at browserling.com/browse. We stream secure, single-session web browsing sessions directly to you as a video but they are hosted on our servers. A one-time browser is deal for private browsing or one-time shopping as these sessions leave no digital footprint like history or cookies. One-Time Browser â€“ What Is It? A one-time browser is a customized web browser designed for enhancing your Internet privacy and security. It typically operates in an isolated environment, such as a virtual machine or a cloud-based container. This isolation usually extends beyond just the browser itself to include network traffic, ensuring that all data transmissions are segregated from the main network. Each browsing session is completely sandboxed, which means thaâ€¦

entry.title: What is a Temporary Browser?
entry.summary: TLDR: You can access a temporary browser session created by me and my team via browserling.com/browse. We spawn single-session browsers on our servers and stream only the browser interface to you. This solution is ideal for casual browsing and testing websites, without leaving a digital trace, such as history or cookies. Temporary Browser â€“ What Is It? A temporary browser is a cloud-hosted web browser that operates for the duration of a single browsing session. Upon session termination, it automatically purges all retained data, including cookies, history, downloaded files, and cached content, ensuring a high degree of privacy and security. This approach effectively mitigates risks associated with data persistence and user tracking. Temporary Browser â€“ How Does It Work? At the start of eacâ€¦

entry.title: We've added another 20 new image tools
entry.summary: Team Browserling keeps shipping! Last week we added 30 new image tools and today we just added another 20 new tools to our Image Tools collection. We've done our job and now it's Google's job to index them and rank them well. Here are the new image tools: Add Effects to Image Convert Image to Polaroid Adjust Image Brightness Adjust Image Contrast Adjust Image Hue Adjust Image Lightness Adjust Image Saturation Upsize an Image Downsize an Image Find Image Dimensions Find Image File Size Change Image Orientation Generate Image from Text Increase Space Around an Image Optimize an Image Recompress a JPG Change Image Quality Refine Edges of an Image Twist Image Pixels Image Viewer Next week we'll add even more tools. See you then!

entry.title: What is an Internet Sandbox?
entry.summary: TLDR: You can access a secure Internet sandbox created by my team and me through browserling.com/browse, where we operate browsers in virtual machines and stream them as a video to you. This setup ensures a controlled and isolated browsing environment, safeguarding your computer from potential cyber threats and allowing for safe exploration of the web. Internet Sandbox â€“ What Is It? An Internet sandbox is a secure, isolated environment where untested, untrusted, or unknown websites and applications can be opened safely, without risking the integrity of the primary operating system. Essentially, it acts like a quarantined area or a secondary Internet browsing environment, separate from the user's main system and network. In this environment, users can safely experiment with new software, exâ€¦

entry.title: What is an Ephemeral Browser?
entry.summary: TLDR: A demo speaks louder than a thousand words. You can connect to an ephemeral browser created by me and my team via browserling.com/browse. We run ephemeral browsers that last for a single session on our servers and stream just the browser window to you. Ephemeral Browser â€“ What Is It? An ephemeral browser is a temporary, cloud-based web browser that exists only for the duration of a single session. It runs on a remote server, ensuring that no data or history is saved on your device, offering enhanced privacy and security. This approach provides a clean, isolated environment for each session, making it ideal for maintaining privacy and safeguarding against data retention. What's the difference between a regular browser and an ephemeral browser? A regular browser stores data like historâ€¦

entry.title: What is an Unbiased Browser?
entry.summary: TLDR: A demo speaks louder than a thousand words. You can connect to an unbiased browser created by me and my team via browserling.com/browse. We run unbiased browsers with no cookies or history on our servers and stream just the browser window to you. Unbiased Browser â€“ What Is It? An unbiased browser is a web browser that operates without any pre-existing data like cookies, local storage, or history, providing a neutral browsing experience. This type of browser is ideal for conducting objective research, as it avoids the influence of personalized search results and ads. Additionally, it's valuable for developers and designers to test websites, ensuring that new visitors receive the intended experience, and for privacy-conscious users who prefer a browsing session free from tracking or prâ€¦

entry.title: Can PDF Files Have Viruses? (And How to Avoid Them)
entry.summary: TLDR: Visit browserling.com/browse to securely open and view potentially risky PDFs. This PDF sandbox, developed by my team and me, offers a secure, isolated environment to open PDFs externally, protecting you from possible viruses within the PDFs. Viruses â€“ Can PDF Files Have Them? Yes, PDF files can contain viruses. These viruses are often embedded in the file and can be activated when the PDF is opened, exploiting vulnerabilities in PDF reader software. This can result in unauthorized system access, data breaches, or other cybersecurity threats. To safeguard against such risks, it's advisable to utilize a PDF sandbox, a secure environment that isolates and scrutinizes PDF files before opening them on your network. How Can I Safely Open PDF Files Without Risking Viruses? To defend againsâ€¦
